document.title: Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Standards

91AE2986852A49A6BDF19DA91BBD2BB8.description:
Evaluate the effectiveness of
strategies to engage team members in a variety
of workplace and community situations.

9377EB92F7A245B0BF50124304C46C15.description:
Select strategies to engage
team members and apply in a variety of situations.

6D3697A156024B8BACC42E5247DE71D9.description:
Examine and summarize
workplace and community situations where
it is important to engage team members to
meet team and organizational goals (e.g.,
meetings, presentations, etc.).

5D697DD4B9304D62AB656B2C33D2942E.description:
Create and implement novel
strategies to engage team members based on
the situation.

DF94D6AFC8724DBB82D6D87046E0CD4E.description:
Assess team dynamics and
match strategies to increase team member
engagement.

F0C45E1E8E114E4DACDEF808FCC8391E.description:
Identify and summarize effective
strategies used to engage team members
to accomplish goals.

3043D6A4C4B2413DB14A140709BC4A38.description:
Create and implement strategies to engage team members to work toward team
and organizational goals in a variety of workplace and community situations (e.g., meetings,
presentations, etc.).

C4F9E4C01CEE46B09C7EC66BD74D870C.description:
Evaluate personal level of cultural
and global competence and implement
plans for growth and improvement in workplace
and community situations.

66160E554AAC4E68B6A37DFEAC17BAAF.description:
Assess the need and benefit
for cultural and global competency and apply
these competencies in team settings at work
and in the community.

5EE78103D32F4FA7B87853C5520481DC.description:
Identify and categorize components
of cultural and global competence
(e.g., awareness, attitude, understanding
cultural differences, etc.).

E031776DBEFA4F88BD711C52A9E0D02A.description:
Devise and implement methods
to obtain feedback from team members
on their experiences after completing workplace
and community projects.

3579B6F42BCC44F085EDBA8BE35101DE.description:
Apply consensus building
techniques to accomplish results in team-oriented
situations.

579224C6B7C54CFC9FA7FAD93C027E99.description:
Identify and summarize techniques
to build consensus in a team situation.

68BCFA22EA1B41E7984B74B4194A590A.description:
Evaluate the effectiveness of
team-oriented projects at work and in the
community and make recommendations for
future improvements.

5CF2AB1FBCD34664835948143DFFBC4D.description:
Formulate action plans to
complete team-oriented projects in the
workplace and community, including plans for
personal contributions.

99565C0A74374E78899F51F08F5B937D.description:
Differentiate the strengths
and talents of all team members needed to
complete projects in the workplace and community.

B8CB4C5416ED41A2B5D7C76FE321DE49.description:
Contribute to team-oriented projects and builds consensus to accomplish results
using cultural global competence in the workplace and community.

2867F63EC00142C281113F003EDE7FC0.description:
Work productively in teams while using cultural/global competence.
Career-ready individuals positively contribute to every team, whether formal or informal. They apply an awareness
of cultural differences to avoid barriers to productive and positive interaction. They find ways to increa

327ACBAA3F4246918A905D61DAEDC571.description:
Design and implement strategies
to prevent or minimize the risks of technology
use in the workplace and community

A4267518056D4F3B84D1FF87131F0741.description:
Analyze the effectiveness of
methods for preventing or minimizing the
risks of technology use.

C82DF1187780456D8598C951900D731E.description:
Synthesize tools and processes
to prevent or minimize risks of technology
use in community and work settings (e.g., risk
management tools, benefit risks, etc.).

BEA604509E924445808E28EAAD1DF4C4.description:
Construct and implement
methods to evaluate personal and organizational
risks of technology in workplace and
community settings.

4270E35DA69242089D5F1CDCB0E7AC8F.description:
Assess the physical, financial
and professional risks associated with using
technology in the workplace and community
and use this information to determine appropriate
uses of technology

299F05FD033046939A3D7C38E223CAC2.description:
Identify and summarize
potential personal and organizational risks
of using technology in the workplace and
community.

37E035815ECD477F9709C2185A404EF3.description:
Evaluate personal and organizational risks of technology use and take actions to
prevent or minimize risks in the workplace and community.

8763BF47C3224E519669CF6F44F632F0.description:
Evaluate effectiveness and
make recommendations for using new technologies,
tools and applications in the workplace
and community.

B4841F02844F408E9EA35E27AD6A909F.description:
Select, apply and use new
technologies, tools and applications in workplace
and community situations to maximize
productivity.

F4C84C9FF69240548678AE56C148CD4D.description:
Examine and categorize
opportunities in workplace and community
settings to use new technologies, tools and
applications to maximize productivity and
efficiency.

8FA87BD06E7E41E096736157AB673FF0.description:
Construct effective communications
to explain the features, benefits and
risks of new technologies, tools and applications
in the workplace and community

B4080B1FFD4644B29158E995260ADECB.description:
Identify and summarize new
technologies, tools and applications to use in
workplace and community situations.

B5AF3DFE58DD4B51B2B2B0D82F6844AC.description:
Analyze advantages and disadvantages
of new technologies, tools and
applications to maximize productivity in the
workplace and community.

029D74039D0743B6A395E397EE0D349B.description:
Research, select and use new technologies, tools and applications to maximize
productivity in the workplace and community.

F4C444F51797456286CE725C976B7F73.description:
Use technology to enhance productivity.
Career-ready individuals find and maximize the productive value of existing and new technology to accomplish
workplace tasks and solve workplace problems. They are flexible and adaptive in acquiring and using new
technology. They are proficient with ubiquitous technology applications. They understand the inherent risks –
personal and organizational – of technology applications, and they take actions to prevent or mitigate these risks.

48BAB8A5134541758F299DED6BB3C59B.description:
Apply skills to complete
common processes involved in pursuing a career
and assimilate input and feedback from
experts (e.g., mentors, teachers, business
persons, etc.) to improve.

BF939DBBDC094D1A8836D8E918730C45.description:
Examine and practice the
skills needed to complete common processes
for pursuing a career (e.g., ability to communicate
about past experiences, ability to articulate
one’s goals and career objectives, etc.).

04399550EC4F46D599D798A20B5023E5.description:
Summarize common processes
involved in pursuing a career (e.g.,
interviews, applications, networking, etc.) and
the appropriate tools used for completing
each.

EEC3DC53372E4EEB92A2D7C387405204.description:
Select and use appropriate
tools to pursue career advancement opportunities
and assimilate feedback from the process
to identify improvements for the future.

1CDA1723AED243F8B20D7E2E27078AF5.description:
Organize personal information
(e.g., goals, experiences, education,
achievements, work examples, etc.) to prepare
and continuously update a set of tools
to aid in the pursuit of a career path.

9F07F313A49646FCA90A44F50532B68F.description:
Identify and explain the purpose
of fundamental tools used to pursue a
career path (e.g., resume, cover letter, portfolio,
etc.) as well as the common components
of each (e.g., content in cover letter, categories
in resume, etc.).

8BA2D10B51C94FF3AE0D93A9EA074243.description:
Identify, prepare, update and improve the tools and skills necessary to pursue a
chosen career path.

574BB82308D64FB08023708869EF50E5.description:
Assimilate input and advice
from experts and formulate plans to implement
into career and personal goals for chosen
career areas.

FCFDA34C5BC043C4A01384D3EA9E7DA5.description:
Devise and implement strategies
to gather input and advice for planning
career and personal goals from trusted
experts.

9248D77F17834C1AA58035F2B544D50D.description:
Identify trusted individuals to
consult with on setting and achieving career
and personal goals (e.g., counselors, teachers,
mentors, coaches, community leaders, etc.).

17C56B8CD0FF4587BD8C4CFE78B225EA.description:
Devise strategies to gather
answers and information from career area
experts and use this information to plan and
execute goals.

4850BF3EA1B84C04A87C52CB4EF6CA84.description:
Assess career and personal
goals and determine additional information
career area experts could provide.

7C52E5C0EFF34CD6B9AF6114F29AB0F2.description:
Summarize ways that input
and/or advice from career area experts could
assist in planning personal career goals.

F7FCDDD8180D4938AB4FE83D87D4FD0D.description:
Develop relationships with and assimilate input and/or advice from experts (e.g.,
counselors, mentors, etc.) to plan career and personal goals in a chosen career area.

CFA7BE69668443AAA33687EBE2E4343A.description:
Evaluate actions taken and
make appropriate modifications to continuous
growth goals in career areas.

0B08503001874C33AC6C121675E183BC.description:
Create goals for personal
improvement and continuous growth in a
career area.

9C4F42059AC14B5D8C080B9E0D8220AC.description:
Identify methods for setting
goals for personal improvement and continuous
growth in a career area (e.g., SMART
goals, training, professional development,
etc.).

79C0939E26174CB6865A7D639268735B.description:
Devise and implement plans
to complete the requirements for career advancement.

D54403F2DAF44F29B676BC0B57CE9744.description:
Analyze the steps to meet
career advancement requirements for potential
careers.

83D16FC51C554B43A9A80EB53D909718.description:
Categorize career advancement
requirements for potential careers (e.g.,
degrees, certification, training, etc.).

085C2CB42BDA4C84926B2CB35A273B21.description:
Examine career advancement requirements (e.g., education, certification, training,
etc.) and create goals for continuous growth in a chosen career.

21B64443468441BE946D6C38481AA4B9.description:
Match potential career opportunities
in career clusters with personal
interests, talents, goals and preferences.

3E00507DE00E4EC5B4B4827ADF2C3584.description:
Analyze skills needed for
potential careers and compare and contrast
skills needed with personal interests, talents,
goals and preferences.

67597955BC804357B0C773AC1E738D61.description:
Examine career clusters and
identify potential career opportunities based
on personal interests, talents, goals and preferences.

BBC016486A9541DF829076AD19EA6637.description:
Plan a career path based on
personal interests, goals, talents and preferences.

D9177163B482474E954CC0E320390BD0.description:
Assess and select areas for
growth and improvement based upon analysis
of personal interests for potential careers.

7CD67B7763E14D1C9BD3D039A890318B.description:
Determine personal interests,
talents, goals and preferences for potential
careers.

0BDFC3AA71DC4F469E1664BC3831A7D5.description:
Identify career opportunities within a career cluster that match personal interests,
talents, goals and preferences.

2FFD3A9C01904151A2CEF644EE5FE313.description:
Plan education and career path aligned to personal goals.
Career-ready individuals take personal ownership of their own educational and career goals, and they regularly act
on a plan to attain these goals. They understand their own career interests, preferences, goals and requirements.
They have perspective regarding the pathways available to them and the time, effort, experience and other
requirements to pursue each, including a path of entrepreneurship. They recognize the value of each step in the
educational and experiential process, and they recognize that nearly all career paths require ongoing education and
experience. They seek counselors, mentors and other experts to assist in the planning and execution of career and
personal goals.

A8EFD964BFA8470DAFB58A2823A8E658.description:
Model respectful and purposeful
behaviors that contribute to positive
morale and culture in the workplace and
community (e.g., effectively communicating,
recognizing accomplishments of others, etc.).

7224F21A4E894CE59498225C3CA4E49F.description:
Devise, implement and evaluate
strategies for continuation and improvement
of respectful and purposeful behaviors
that contribute to positive morale and culture
in workplace and community (e.g., recognize
others’ skills, promote collaboration, etc.).

BF7281AB0FBE4E20BCA0EBC2BF1A7BF4.description:
Examine personal levels of
respectful and purposeful behaviors and summarize
how they are demonstrated (e.g., treat
others with respect, model professionalism,
etc.).

B7683B4DF9144842936583848DD8D0C1.description:
Evaluate workplace and
community cultures and determine specific
behaviors and actions that contribute to
building the morale and culture.

5F171A664A694EB9BC3D53A11359239D.description:
Analyze the relationship
between demonstrating respectful and purposeful
behaviors (e.g., collaborative, clear
expectations, etc.) and increased influence in
the workplace and community.

8449EF42B900410A96E9E343A63E9F0C.description:
Identify and summarize
respectful and purposeful behaviors that
contribute to positive morale and culture in
workplace and community settings (e.g., positively
influencing others, effectively communicating,
etc.).

66A75222CBB245EEB03FFE62FA29D567.description:
Demonstrate behaviors that contribute to a positive morale and culture in the
workplace and community (e.g., positively influencing others, effectively communicating, etc.).

4475CBFDA0844C42B13B9C94AA30DB6D.description:
Model personal management
skills and identify opportunities for continuous
improvement.

6F430EC9C1F742B88CE773C6FDA3F2B9.description:
Conduct a self-assessment
of personal management skills used in daily
workplace or community situations.

F14F7AE4F58B44DE84BC70699484F0C7.description:
Examine and describe personal
management skills (e.g., time management,
prioritizing, setting goals, etc.) that are
individually implemented and demonstrated
in workplace and community situations.

65C3993105254F5FAE57438AA4E11CD4.description:
Evaluate opportunities to
apply personal management skills into daily
tasks and responsibilities.

2F77AD9D62934092BD2092552E43193D.description:
Analyze leaders’ use of
effective personal management skills and
determine how they apply them in workplace
and community situations.

CC8899ADC44F4518A6A18A3B1F0770CC.description:
Identify and summarize personal
management skills necessary to function
effectively in the workplace (e.g., time
management, planning, prioritizing, etc.).

C8ACECE83DAF4FC68AD03586D54358C9.description:
Implement personal management skills to function effectively and efficiently in the
workplace (e.g., time management, planning, prioritizing, etc.).

1EC8B8C83B024E9F87F0E276BDEA0D5B.description:
Model characteristics and
actions of ethical and effective leaders in
workplace and community situations (e.g.,
integrity, self-awareness, etc.).

CE51B434CE244AE88760401946DEBA38.description:
Conduct a self-assessment
of personal ethical and effective leadership
characteristics (e.g., relates to others, focused,
integrity, etc.) and reflect upon the
results to identify opportunities for improvement.

A39385B6D8E942ACA5151A43D7D1B3DD.description:
Reflect upon and summarize
situations where ethical and effective
leadership characteristics were needed and/
or personally demonstrated (e.g., motivation,
empathy, etc.).

BB8CAAC508CF49548EEBF3D1C5AEC1CE.description:
Evaluate ethical and effective
leadership characteristics demonstrated by
others.

67B224D540ED4F6DA0F420862EC3F546.description:
Analyze workplace and community
leaders and determine what ethical
and effective leadership characteristics they
demonstrate.

91EA661939DF4D80952B0CF7E7175DDF.description:
Identify and summarize the
characteristics of ethical and effective leaders
in workplace and community settings.

A20092EE8C694A75AA9EABDE28EC5C88.description:
Model characteristics of ethical and effective leaders in the workplace and
community (e.g. integrity, self-awareness, self-regulation, etc.).

81721DEAD0F1472FB4AFF4DBD02D51B1.description:
Model integrity, ethical leadership and effective management.
Career-ready individuals readily recognize problems in the workplace, understand the nature of the problem, and
devise effective plans to solve the problem. They are aware of problems when they occur and take action quickly
to address the problem. They thoughtfully investigate the root cause of the problem prior to introducing solutions.
They carefully consider the options to solve the problem. Once a solution is agreed upon, they follow through to
ensure the problem is solved, whether through their own actions or the actions of others.

93BFA234F48B4E7DB8E9FAD38B12031F.description:
Implement and evaluate
plans to solve workplace and community
problems.

B4A24590871740B5BA9960AB2F69B013.description:
Create plans to solve workplace
and community problems.

4A210B450279486CB9D36E955D9B4DAE.description:
Identify and analyze the
elements of a plan for solving workplace and
community problems (e.g., budget, timeline,
etc.).

693FBCA82D14497AA91FD0DDBB6A88C9.description:
Evaluate the effectiveness of
different problem-solving models for reaching
a solution to workplace and community
issues.

1787FF9EBA884A7B9181412DB85DB3D3.description:
Analyze and determine the
best problem-solving model to apply to
workplace and community problems.

99542D1CBF8A4D2280D0999B8D57BA83.description:
Identify different types of
problem solving models and summarize their
applicability to workplace and community
situations.

74FAE1C572344177BB46DA5D8B540EE4.description:
Establish plans to solve workplace and community problems and execute them with
resiliency.

32A0BDBBA39548D9B04F1F65AEC4D0F2.description:
Evaluate and select solutions
with greatest potential for success to solve
workplace and community problems.

DAD339064277436AA0B628C54A7DF1EB.description:
Apply decision-making processes
to generate possible solutions to solve
workplace and community problems.

72CC3932A05647A294ED0CC42F95CA49.description:
Identify and summarize
steps in the decision-making process to solve
workplace and community problems.

758185EA808A4329AA6FF3501C1A6E24.description:
Devise and implement strategies
to evaluate the effectiveness of solutions
for resolving workplace and community
problems.

B1AE62B321D3483E810890EC9067D246.description:
Assimilate and prioritize
potential solutions to solve problems in the
workplace and community.

D5D1F83FF9214D99B66345EF9B2937A0.description:
Investigate and summarize
potential tools and resources used to solve
problems in the workplace and community

F881A660FD864B06A21D8C84E09E0974.description:
Investigate, prioritize and select solutions to solve problems in the workplace and
community.

E6E118359CDD48289706CBF2DB7A4AE8.description:
Devise and implement strategies
to apply reason, logic and input from
multiple perspectives to solve workplace and
community problems

29EA260AECD741D3A4697AAD13A4B645.description:
Assess solutions to workplace
and community problems for evidence
of reason, logic and consideration of multiple
perspectives.

8D0F3BAD546F4906BDF7EDE7998A7FEB.description:
Examine and identify opportunities
to apply reason, logic and multiple
perspectives to solve problems in workplace
and community situations.

33A6E2F7734140A3ABBCD3C8812BEF7C.description:
Evaluate how applying critical
thinking skills can impact workplace and
community situations.

99C847B3A16B4BAFB1762563C12A2D74.description:
Apply steps for critical thinking
to a variety of workplace and community
situations.

7CF0986443EE4E42BB6658474D978B50.description:
Identify and summarize steps
to think critically (e.g., identify problem, gather
information, brainstorm solutions, etc.).

079397116D3C4B1C9FFC191D576EC051.description:
Apply reason and logic to evaluate workplace and community situations from
multiple perspectives.

A86CAE0169F64713AFCDE975E8255F73.description:
Utilize critical thinking to make sense of problems and persevere in
solving them.
Career-ready individuals readily recognize problems in the workplace, understand the nature of the problem, and
devise effective plans to solve the problem. They are aware of problems when they occur and take action quickly
to address the problem. They thoughtfully investigate the root cause of the problem prior to introducing solutions.
They carefully consider the options to solve the problem. Once a solution is agreed upon, they follow through to
ensure the problem is solved, whether through their own actions or the actions of others.

F93141D0EA37497CA6563F4955E6E549.description:
Create and defend proposals
for new technologies, practices and ideas
using valid and reliable data sources.

E4D12731CE784356BB48AEFB641A0AFF.description:
Assimilate data to assist in
making a decision about the adoption of a
new technology, practice or idea by workplaces
and community organizations.

AE181AF372984D82AA1B9198104EFC2E.description:
Categorize potential technologies,
practices and ideas that could be
adopted by workplaces and community
organizations.

52CF60A96CB841E3905E84EC79D3DD71.description:
Propose valid and reliable
data sources to use when considering the
adoption of new technologies, practices and
ideas.

9ED0512442ED42CFB0560406770759C8.description:
Assess data sources for reliability
and validity.

1080B34D73D747ADB4943BBCF9868FC4.description:
Identify and summarize types
of data sources available to research new
technologies and practices for workplaces
and community organizations (e.g., blog,
research, news, etc.).

0D356DD3B04149A8BC23FE3649E7592F.description:
Evaluate the validity of sources and data used when considering the adoption of
new technologies, practices and ideas in the workplace and community.

CF717DB25F6D4904ABC9DF1B073A3BD4.description:
Design plans for use and implementation
of reliable research methods to
generate data for decision making in workplace
and community situations

E6E76EDF3DB44999880FE9382E414893.description:
Assess the positives and negatives
of using different research strategies
and methods to generate data for workplace
and community decisions and use this information
to select appropriate methods.

15F2F16D2F0B4A1EAE2041B3567BF224.description:
Identify the data requirements
for potential decisions in the workplace
and community and determine possible
research strategies to use to generate the
necessary data.

24C79D0986F24071909109E62E2B33F9.description:
Evaluate business’ and organizations’
use of research methods and processes
and propose recommendations for
improvement.

3B55373CB48D4879BDD259375AC5EC0B.description:
Analyze how different research
methods are used to generate data in
a variety of situations.

88D07C993B1543D3A0D019D32E6103C0.description:
Identify and summarize reliable
research processes and methods used to
generate data for decision-making.

D5C4909C1E644666A34E30B2DB36E287.description:
Select and implement reliable research processes and methods to generate data for
decision-making in the workplace and community.

2A9CD4C20A994B829F3E2139BCBEAA94.description:
Employ valid and reliable research strategies.
Career-ready individuals are discerning in accepting and using new information to make decisions, change practices
or inform strategies. They use a reliable research process to search for new information. They evaluate the validity
of sources when considering the use and adoption of external information or practices. They use an informed
process to test new ideas, information and practices in their workplace situation.

313F95BC0D3A4DC48E67CF639F363955.description:
Evaluate and execute strategies
for using stakeholder input and feedback
to improve a plan of action for introducing a
new idea or innovation into the workplace or
community.

3F20825A974748969AFE577DEB6B38D5.description:
Elicit and assimilate input
and feedback from individuals and organizations
about new ideas or innovations for the
workplace or community.

4EFB020FE6F14F4FA4FCF14093A8D69B.description:
Identify individuals and
organizations (i.e., stakeholders) that need
to provide input and feedback on new ideas
or innovation prior to implementation in the
workplace or community.

22F5DD921DEC4E37B6CA09063FFF07FA.description:
Design a plan of action to
introduce a new idea or innovation into the
workplace and community.

F5A58C59F24244BABADBF80B53EEA3B6.description:
Assess and communicate the
risks and benefits of applying new ideas and
innovations to the workplace and community

51943E25DCAC4B42A1C76F6BE73D0A8B.description:
Examine workplace and community
situations to identify opportunities for
improvement through the introduction of new
ideas and innovations.

4AB3288613CB414981070C6B5E33138A.description:
Create and execute a plan of action to act upon new ideas and introduce
innovations to workplace and community organizations.

4AFB82C26D3445568693521249FB7933.description:
Construct and implement
methods to improve workplace and community
processes and procedures.

93B1758E7BBE46D2BB5FC4FC50F9D5E8.description:
Predict and communicate
potential gains in efficiency and value-added
from implementing an improved process or
procedure.

FFA2D846CA6C48BE839DFEAB46A07858.description:
Identify and summarize
methods used to increase efficiency and add
value to workplace and community processes
and procedures (e.g., individual input, scheduled
reviews, etc.).

8B5C86361F574D5388EF59032C4807BA.description:
Evaluate past workplace and
community situations and determine how
processes and procedures impacted outcomes.

5AB0A6B9B5EE4B8FB6C95BD6E4BC9DF5.description:
Analyze how processes and
procedures are implemented in workplace
and community situations (e.g., employee
evaluations, vacation, leave time, etc.).

7633F46FEE4B4E1A84FC7BC44FE7FDCC.description:
Identify and categorize the
types of processes and procedures used in
workplaces and the community (e.g., health
and safety, email, compliance, etc.).

139516D605584B65A22D1DDC5453C5BE.description:
Assess a variety of workplace and community situations to identify ways to add
value and improve the efficiency of processes and procedures.

4D44CD311D1D4C71ADAA6696027CF2B2.description:
Devise and apply strategies
(e.g., ask questions, brainstorm ideas, present
facts and information etc.) to challenge common
assumptions in workplace and community
situations.

EA0FBEA3B7F247328EF032E0FD917EAC.description:
Analyze how assumptions
can impact outcomes in a variety of workplace
and community situations.

37CF86A55FB64E1EAEF1FD39ED9090B3.description:
Define “assumption” and
identify different types and sources of assumptions
that could impact effectiveness in
workplace and community situations.

18BCBD58633B40ED8F66B20B56FCA6FB.description:
Evaluate workplace and
community situations and devise strategies to
apply original ideas.

C1A0F35F23CF4AAFA8E121C006602A6E.description:
Synthesize information,
knowledge and experiences to generate ideas
for workplace and community situations.

C717831550C74CF08421336B1A2DE6A2.description:
Identify and summarize steps
for generating ideas used in the workplace
and community.

7884AC43B7A247F797E793E7DDB15F96.description:
Synthesize information, knowledge and experience to generate original ideas and
challenge assumptions in the workplace and community.

51C1BB7B1E18466E93FA3F154047378A.description:
Demonstrate creativity and innovation.
Career-ready individuals regularly think of ideas that solve problems in new and different ways, and they contribute
those ideas in a useful and productive manner to improve their organization. They can consider unconventional
ideas and suggestions as solutions to issues, tasks or problems, and they discern which ideas and suggestions
will add greatest value. They seek new methods, practices and ideas from a variety of sources and seek to apply
those ideas to their own workplace. They take action on their ideas and understand how to bring innovation to an
organization.

18994CC0373045C4BD198402A995DB09.description:
Evaluate workplace and
community situations and propose decisions
to be made based upon the positive impact
made on environment, social and economic
areas.

0A6E82DAE5B54A2C9D400B4F183CF8F6.description:
Assess past decisions made
in workplace and community and analyze
their effects on environmental, social and
economic situations.

CB93617FD5CD4F7D9610B7C0E42409FC.description:
Examine information about
environmental, social and economic impacts
when making decisions in the workplace and
community.

48E8BB113BBE4786A08C6B1AC05EEACD.description:
Evaluate and defend decisions
applied in the workplace and community
situations.

3617B54B7B0949D191D48DB79BA55D86.description:
Apply a structured decision-making
process to improve workplace
and community situations

4A25C973109E4B03907EDA8EB1BF4178.description:
Examine areas in the workplace
and community where decisions will
make a positive impact

B1144637DA1A4BAE810787CE79A5CB90.description:
Make, defend and evaluate decisions at work and in the community using
information about the potential environmental, social and economic impacts.

C4F7BE4BE2304D679F19C2B7A89C244A.description:
Synthesize information and
resources and apply to workplace and community
situations to make positive decisions.

CE04D94D93A74F20AB7CD4A4D2C47132.description:
Analyze workplace and community
decisions and assess the information
and resources used to make those decisions.

3CA414CB4C3B4F10A28D24CEAF4E999E.description:
Classify the types of information
(e.g., data, research, procedures,
regulations, etc.) and resources (e.g., human,
financial, technology, time, etc.) that may
be used to make workplace and community
decisions.

86D035A8340D431089D9604623F8D3CD.description:
Evaluate workplace and
community situations and recommend the
information and resources needed to support
good decisions.

5C07DC0C5E004395B47535E6CC678F48.description:
Analyze past workplace and
community situations to determine if appropriate
information and resources were used
to make an effective decision.

2A0E877D063648FCAB9A0EE023778059.description:
Examine and explain the
relationship between information, resources
and good decision making in workplace and
community situations.

A5DC1122765D4881A15F30D6421773B3.description:
Evaluate workplace and community
decision-making processes and devise
strategies for improvement.

7458353CCCA242CDBABB02E63ECFF2E4.description:
Analyze how the process of
decision making is used in workplace and
community situations.

4053B5BDE7F54EF085E7B1AF8518C4E1.description:
Examine and describe the
steps in the decision-making process used in
the workplace and community.

4B8328DBDF9B45438594939F93F87AC7.description:
Assess, identify and synthesize the information and resources needed to make
decisions that positively impact the workplace and community.

4ED2974A53EF43C29742A9C9A36E8633.description:
Consider the environmental, social and economic impacts of decisions.
Career-ready individuals understand the interrelated nature of their actions and regularly make decisions that
positively impact and/or mitigate negative impact on other people, organizations and the environment. They
are aware of and utilize new technologies, understandings, procedures, materials and regulations affecting the
nature of their work as it relates to the impact on the social condition, the environment and the profitability of the
organization.

E5FA84B964A4470484B3C5D15FEBCEA7.description:
Model active listening strategies
in formal and informal settings.

F78B1A9F91C34F4D894A173377A16811.description:
Apply and evaluate personal
level of active listening strategies in formal
and informal settings.

28374DD1E4814433B80F8BB56D2F8511.description:
Observe and identify use
of active listening strategies in formal (e.g.,
speeches, presentations, etc.) and informal
(e.g., conversations, meetings, etc.) settings.

8820E1F027F343B88E82D18902E27743.description:
Evaluate personal effectiveness
and devise a plan to improve active
listening skills.

DEB65737BC1247B6BB94C006B0A8D79D.description:
Apply active listening strategies
(e.g., be attentive, observe non-verbal
cues, ask clarifying questions, etc.).

69E6B6140CBA4EF2A78FEB3A819C9DC8.description:
Research and summarize
components of active listening (e.g., eye contact,
have an open mind, restate, etc.)

A02BCA7C091442399F447BFC09A8132F.description:
Model active listening strategies when interacting with others in formal and
informal settings.

054657CD4F3F4C5B8100F119B8446E6B.description:
Compose clear and coherent
written documents and visuals (e.g., agendas,
audio-visuals, drafts, forms, etc.) that are
adapted to the audience needs in both formal
and informal settings.

F44B4415D2B5406697A80706B9358FC1.description:
Apply techniques for ensuring
clarity, logic and coherence to edit written
and visual communications (e.g., emails,
reports, presentations, technical documents,
diagrams, etc.).

39C98A0DC292438F97052B5FCE2FC6FA.description:
Identify and examine methods
for producing clear, reasoned and coherent
written and visual communication
that are appropriate to the task, purpose and
audience (e.g., audience analysis, objective
development, etc.)

10A8DBC85B6D4397959975848F1F433E.description:
Evaluate the effectiveness of
different forms of written and visual communication
for achieving their intended purpose.

C6ABEE796EEF4ED688B0317CC3FDB85E.description:
Compare and contrast the
structure of different forms of written and
visual communication.

7C3D7DBF25544241BDC8512629E1FA83.description:
Research and summarize
the purpose of different forms of written and
visual communication in formal and informal
settings (e.g., letters, emails, reports, social
media, graphics, diagrams, etc.).

EA7F5D78777F4BA5BDA981BC6512AA77.description:
Produce clear, reasoned and coherent written and visual communication in formal
and informal settings.

BBC59E063A2548959EBB2BF4CE3EA6C9.description:
Evaluate personal strengths
and areas for growth with regard to speaking
formally and informally with clarity, logic, purpose
and professionalism, and identify ways
to improve.

AADAE96D2BED41D7A6455C39A58DDD5A.description:
Apply strategies for speaking
with clarity, logic, purpose and professionalism
in a variety of situations in formal
and informal settings.

DCC51FCB8A574C4CBF1DF810131D4E02.description:
Examine and assess personal
ability to speak with clarity, logic, purpose
and professionalism in formal and informal
settings (e.g., speeches, interviews, presentations,
oral reports, etc.).

1B1F34252FEE4FF1A95FD0F63113DD38.description:
Evaluate other’s verbal and
non-verbal communications (e.g., speeches,
presentations, oral reports, etc.) and propose
recommendations for improvement in clarity,
logic, purpose and professionalism.

5E862DD9814D49B08E70AA1A9DF4FB68.description:
Analyze use of verbal and
non-verbal communication strategies in workplace
situations.

C7699BF1787747E382DB5A5F2EB5AA47.description:
Identify and categorize
strategies for ensuring clarity, logic, purpose
and professionalism in verbal and non-verbal
communication (e.g., vocal tone, organization
of thoughts, eye contact, preparation, etc.).

FB8C387A8CA84730918F99C86093353D.description:
Speak using strategies that ensure clarity, logic, purpose and professionalism in
formal and informal settings.

833F6A475C074149B7036F49AC9F7845.description:
Communicate clearly, effectively and with reason.
Career-ready individuals communicate thoughts, ideas and action plans with clarity, whether using written, verbal
and/or visual methods. They communicate in the workplace with clarity and purpose to make maximum use of
their own and others’ time. They are excellent writers; they master conventions, word choice and organization, and
use effective tone and presentation skills to articulate ideas. They are skilled at interacting with others; they are
active listeners and speak clearly and with purpose. Career-ready individuals think about the audience for their
communication and prepare accordingly to ensure the desired outcome.

51158E4CF43047C29FCF891CD4EE72BD.description:
Design, implement and evaluate
a personal financial management plan

EB17C9A73AB24D2C9E5585449F8C0B37.description:
Analyze the effectiveness
of a personal financial management plan and
explain how this practice may contribute to
future financial independence.

FDCFA24D11D0432F9A919C63EEB71AF0.description:
Examine and categorize personal
financial practices (e.g., earning, spending,
use of management tools, credit, etc.)

4A7395A623804B108BB587CD86FF4E71.description:
Appraise and select management
tools to include in a personal financial
management plan

889BD01DD46F4998AE330FDFB6A7F673.description:
Analyze management tools
available for managing personal finances
(e.g., software, calendars, banks, financial
institutions, etc.).

9E243E75FDD149DBAF4C1D8B0F6FB5DE.description:
Research and examine
components in a personal financial management
plan (e.g., income, expense, budgeting,
savings, credit, etc.).

39518B024C1C4CCB9A71D6BF7E6FD130.description: Design and implement a personal financial management plan.

7D07445BD4C44F3CB3C2310AA982F9CD.description:
Evaluate personal wellness plans
in workplace and community organizations
and the effectiveness of the plans.

8CE3C235EA4847059CDE35BAD1C97CB9.description:
Analyze the relationship
between personal wellness and workplace
performance.

7AB39F0FA30A4218BD86A6F026FF27E5.description:
Research the impact of
personal wellness plans in workplaces and/or
communities.

E09474CEC5AA425B90016776E03C27DA.description:
Create, implement and continually
evaluate a personal wellness plan.

601D70A6918644A4A887E348B45B5599.description:
Assess the risks and benefits
of implementing a personal wellness plan

E1887A2952D34296A9F1CD4463884320.description:
Examine and summarize
components in a personal wellness plan (e.g.,
healthy diet, exercise, mental health activities,
etc.).

4EE6D7854BDC47BDA3130752D0DA2EFC.description: Design and implement a personal wellness plan.

C584E603E14643E9ABD8284B7B441657.description:
Attend to personal health and financial well-being.
Career-ready individuals understand the relationship between personal health, workplace performance and personal
well-being; they act on that understanding to regularly practice healthy diet, exercise and mental health activities.
Career-ready individuals also take regular action to contribute to their personal financial well-being, understanding
that personal financial security provides the peace of mind required to contribute more fully to their own career
success.

F9F53310F3BC43E5A156D932FC67EA1E.description:
Apply technical concepts to
solve problems in the community and reflect
upon results achieved.

1110F79157C84650A4EAF654C3333CB9.description:
Assess community problems
and identify the most appropriate technical
concepts to apply.

4562FE4B2892466A9DF3FFF7D490397F.description:
Identify opportunities to
apply technical concepts to solve problems in
the community (e.g., identify how to: ensure
safe routes to schools, reduce vandalism,
reduce air pollution, etc.).

B83DDBBAD1454B10B56F89B384AB0F3D.description:
Apply technical concepts to
solve problems in the workplace and reflect
upon the results achieved.

D3EFF3DAFF594BC3944465EBC118BDE0.description:
Assess workplace problems
and distinguish the most appropriate technical
concepts to apply.

729A237F54574B4589805C91B2EBB4C9.description:
Identify opportunities to
apply technical concepts to solve problems in
the workplace (e.g., identify how to: increase
sales, better customer service, reduce inputs,
reduce waste, ensure sustainability, etc.).

506A6D61A50E4F42963C15CA43E0AF76.description:
Use strategic thinking to connect and apply technical concepts to solve problems in
the workplace and community.

14D4B89B924A48D58EC46E75ED2D7024.description:
Apply academic knowledge
and skills to solve problems in the community
and reflect upon results achieved.

DD5BCF70D92741529A8ED4FFA42B238C.description:
Assess community problems
and identify the most appropriate academic
knowledge and skills to apply.

332F3F880DE54473BC4117028F460515.description:
Distinguish opportunities to
apply academic learning to solve problems
in the community (e.g., identify how to: stop
businesses from closing, increase access to
emergency services, eliminate hunger, reduce
unemployment, etc.).

3C4A555585884E7D97EACBB96F5D908C.description:
Apply academic knowledge
and skills to solve problems in the workplace
and reflect upon the results achieved.

D3E9B7FF21AC486B8F31D1596E074D08.description:
Assess workplace problems
and identify the most appropriate academic
knowledge and skills to apply.

C55D2F23F03C43D7AEC8C1A8D94E7EE3.description:
Distinguish opportunities to
apply academic learning to solve problems in
the workplace (e.g., identify how to: increase
productivity, reduce costs, lower inputs, etc.).

DAD03434E7124151BCFF0261AF2A9D26.description:
Use strategic thinking to connect and apply academic learning, knowledge and
skills to solve problems in the workplace and community.

AE3BA90D402240C8BFB8965209AFFB88.description:
Career-ready individuals readily access and use the knowledge and skills acquired through experience and education
to be more productive. They make connections between abstract concepts with real-world applications, and they
make correct insights about when it is appropriate to apply the use of an academic skill in a workplace situation.

CB4639395B6B4D3693F7B0F775C65130.description:
Devise, implement, and
evaluate strategies for personal involvement
in civic service at work and in the community
(e.g., volunteer at food pantry, community
clean-up, join organizations or committees,
etc.).

0AB1D093F8604B1D8AC991B21125DB3D.description:
Assess available civic service
opportunities at workplaces and in the
community (e.g., community events, attend
meetings, etc.).

E6AF1414A400404EA8973D67DB9EBE08.description:
Identify civic service opportunities
in workplaces and the community
(e.g., organizations, fundraising, etc.).

D74425137C994F94BD98BAB30D779441.description:
Devise, implement, and evaluate
strategies for involvement in professional
service opportunities at work and in the community
(e.g., coaching/mentorship, presentations
at meetings, etc.).

12DA3C4A8B7B43B7A5488D3FE4159C41.description:
Assess available professional
service opportunities at workplaces and in
community (e.g., trainings, organizing events,
etc.).

BD70B7DA3AB04D95A86DB33D1B345FB4.description:
Define and categorize opportunities
for professional service at work and
in the community (e.g., serve on committees,
attend meetings, etc.).

D7F3F100525143AEA5DCC8D9A308D4DF.description:
Identify and act upon opportunities for professional and civic service at work and in
the community.

4A2D212506C143BDAC13F893FA0EB637.description:
Make and defend professional
decisions after evaluating their near- and
long-term impacts on employers and community

F725611970A64ED1A338DAD2EE4CD069.description:
Analyze the pros and cons of
professional decisions based upon impact on
employers and community

685EA23E3A5849D58BF5479ED1FFC73D.description:
Classify professional decisions
by their near- and long-term impact on
employers and community (e.g., decisions involving:
financials, business goals, processes,
customer satisfaction, corporate image, etc.).

A2E03F8657A248B8B8FBE47DC548E905.description:
Make and defend personal
decisions after analyzing their near- and longterm
impacts on self and others.

3938920681F0416ABC98332084E0B42B.description:
Assess the pros and cons of
personal decisions based on their anticipated
impact on self and others.

A28514E0D81744E88298418742FEE0C1.description:
Classify the near- and longterm
impacts of personal decisions on self
and others (e.g., decisions involving health,
relationships, money, perceptions, education,
etc.).

7D8E4774A0534B75BEA672A6235629A4.description:
Evaluate and consider the near-term and long-term impacts of personal and
professional decisions on employers and community before taking action.

C1553573E0E3423AA81C42C2774ED45C.description:
Model personal responsibility
in workplace and community situations.

EAF529CB6205461F9E247F25F96F85D4.description:
Assess personal level of
responsibility and examine opportunities for
improvement.

BE7A02271B914310A24F4CBB21606E6C.description:
Distinguish personal levels
of responsibility, which can be applied in the
workplace and community.

91F3A817918E4847953F14D0401BA310.description:
Evaluate past workplace and
community situations and determine how
personal responsibility positively or negatively
impacted outcomes.

49D2C46269904B0597BA8A872DA7A0B0.description:
Analyze and predict how
personal responsibility impacts the workplace
and community.

4E9DF5921DA84173A8CDF635E6D55009.description:
Define personal responsibility
and distinguish how it applies in workplace
and community (e.g., make educated choices,
listen and follow directions, ask for help when
needed, meet expected standards, etc.).

62C4E7AF6F7E4D38A415A7F53588E911.description: Model personal responsibility in the workplace and community.

7D4E9AFB67894455AEAD215327EC8250.description: Act as a responsible and contributing citizen and employee.
